reviews.sentence: Hyat. Hostels had better service than this. I took a late bus to Indianapolis but for some reasons that bus was delayed for hours and hours so I reached the hotel almost 7 am the next morning. When I approached the check in counter I was greeted with Sorry we have no rooms available. I told the snooty guy that I have a reservation for the previous night but he would not believe it as the hotel was full there was a marathon event in the city on the day I arrived. I had to show him my printed confirmation even though he could have asked for my name and check their booking records in the first place. When he asked for a credit card for incidentals and I showed him my platinum card his attitude obviously changed I thought really. To be honest I never felt discriminated against like this before. Anyway eventually I was given a room on the 9th floor. Next in the room there was no available pen to write my request for some amenities and so when I was going out for sightseeing I took the request card with me and filled it up downstairs and tried to hand it to one of the staff in the check in counter but she refused to accept it. She said that the room cleaning staff are the ones responsible for those requests and that she could not go to where they were and the cleaning staff were not allowed to go to the lobby. I could see the walkie talkie they use to contact porters but guess what she told me to go back to my room on the 9th floor and put the request card in my room. I could not believe what I just heard and I almost exploded in anger. I did it anyway just so not to ruin my day. When I got back to the hotel in the evening the card was still there but the requested amenities were not. Fortunately I saw one of the cleaning staff and so I rushed into her and handed the request card. At first she would not accept it but then had a second thought and said she had take care of it. Which she did not. Until I checked out. As one of my criteria in assessing the hotel service upon my check out I asked if they could mail out a post card for me. To my surprise they did. And they did not charge me for it. Well the staff this time was different from the day before. The room itself was nice with a view of the capitol which was a paid upgrade. But other than that the customer service was terrible. I had better experience with hostels.

NICE HOTEL. Business meeting with a stay over at the Hyat. Very nice hotel. Breakfast at the restaurant – good food – good service – good selection. Will look forward to additional visits in the coming years. The location is also excellent forward to getting around downtown. Can walk to many other restaurants andor venues.

Pretty good. Everything was great but housekeeping kept forgetting to give us toilet paper when we ran out or were low. The hotel was connected to the mall and convention center so we rarely had to go outside.

Great Hotel in a great city. Excellent hotel everything was very nice. The only complaint is that when there are a large number of guests coming from a convention or concert the elevators are very slow. One was broken while we were there and it took 25 minutes to go up to our room and put our stuff in there and come back down. Other than that this is a top notch facility and the staff was great.

Great Stay. I enjoyed my stay. The hotel and room were very clean. The staff was super friendly. Although they do not offer complimentary breakfast which would be great for people coming for conventions and needing to move through breakfast quickly they have many restaurants right in the hotel that are awesome.

Great location. service lacking. Good things first this hotel is walking distance to pretty much anything downtown lots of restaurants and shopping Lucas Oil Stadium convention center. it is also a nice looking hotel in the public areas room was comfortable. Not so good. Overpriced I thought. Our room was on the small side and the two beds were doubles not queens. We were there on a busy weekend with a lot of events and the hotel was clearly quite full but I felt service was lacking even considering that. Although valet service was friendly it was rather slow and 40 night is a bit much. Prices seemed on par with valet hotel in Chicago not Indianapolis. Bad We booked well in advance at a group rate and were confirmed for a double room. When I arrived I was told there were no double rooms available. I was offered a king with a rolaway. That was not really acceptable to me even at a reduced rate and after seeing the size of the rooms I do not think that would have been comfortable at all but it was better than no room so I agreed. While they were looking for a room for me three different parties checked in at the desk next to mine and all three somehow got double rooms despite checking in after me. After the third one the woman working on my reservation told me she had found a double for me. Great. As I said the room was small but at least it was the double I had requested. The second day we were there housekeeping came at 830am. We were not ready yet and asked them to come back later they never came back. We got back to our room around 3 pm and it had not been serviced. I called the front desk they said someone would come up so we went out to the mall for a bit and came back and the room was just as it had been when we left. I called again and the woman who answered seemed surprised that we would bother to call again but said she would let housekeeping know I was waiting. A few minutes later I got a call from a manager who said I was supposed to have checked out and when was I leaving they would service the room then. We were reserved for another night and I let him know that at which point he muttered something about the group rate and then said someone would come up. We finally got the room serviced 20 minutes after that well after 4 pm. There was no apology for either the lack of service or the suggestion that I overstayed my reservation.

Bed bugs. I recently stayed at this hotel for a dance competition. My overall room seemed fine but my friends room had a bedbug infestation and she was forced to move to a completely different hotel as the Hyat was sold out. They seem completely incapable of handling the crowd from the convention as the Starbucks in the lobby had a line of people 30 deep and only two employees working. The hotel check in staff was lovely and very accommodating. I was taking an early morning flight out and when I went outside there was no valet to call for a taxi so I had to go to the desk and ask someone to help me. Not exactly what I expected service wise from a Hyat Regency. The location however is exceptional.

Nice Stay. Was impressed with the hotel open air concept with 20 floors. Stayed on 20th floor great views. Room was nice and bed was very comfortable. Could use a few cosmetic touch ups paint chipping on edges of doors etc. Staff was great food was very good also. Elevators do get slow and full with conferences.

Great downtown hotel. Our stay was fantastic. we booked the Hyat Regency because we were going to an event at the Pavilion at Pan Am and would be having drinks. The hotel was within walking distance of our event and other activities we ended up going to after the event. My only complaint would be the parking. although there is a garage it does not belong to the hotel and it is an additional charge.

Fitness Business Trip. The hotel our convention was booked so we stayed at the Hyat Regency near by. It worked out great. Very short walk to meetings and nice to have a change of scenery. My husband and I were very comfortable from beginning to end. Very clean too.

Great Customer Service Conference Venue. Stayed here for a training conference. Excellent venue for this type of activity. Within walking distance to a host of restaurants. Every staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. 10 stars for customer service. One of the ladys who hosted breakfast at the conference indicated she had been in the industry for over 20 years indicating this hotel has a high retention rate.

Great Customer Service Conference Venue. Stayed here for a training conference. Excellent venue for this type of activity. Within walking distance to a host of restaurants. Every staff we encountered was friendly and helpful. 10 stars for customer service. One of the ladys who hosted breakfast at the conference indicated she had been in the industry for over 20 years indicating this hotel has a high retention rate.

Excellent and convenient hotel. I was attending TAPI PaperCon and selected the Hyat Regency from the choice of conference hotels. The hotel is attractive and well maintained with a professional courteous and friendly staff. I taught a course at the hotel Saturday and Sunday and also attended the TAPI Fellows Luncheon at the Hyat on Sunday. The conference room food and beverages were exceptional.

Great hotel right in downtown Indy. Front desk outstanding housekeeping spectacular room clean and spacious wonderful location easy walk to numerous restaurants Convention Center sports venues. Great experience. Highly recommend the Hyat Regency in downtown Indy.

Great location for the Convention Center and great service. If your trip includes the Indiana Convention Center you will not only be next door but there is a covered walkway that takes you from the Hyat to the Convention Center. There are great food options in close walking distance esp St Elmo Burger Study Nada. And the service at the Hyat is great. The Front Office Manager Daniel Blanchete went above and beyond to help us. Thank you Daniel.

Room with a view. I have always had nothing but stellar experiences when staying at the Hyat Regency in Indianapolis. I love that I often get a view of the Capital building the staff is always helpful and kind and its location is perfect. There is so much within walking distance it is incredible shopping restaurants Lucas Oil the convention center etc.

Very few issues. good solid experience. Overall a good experience in light of high hotel traffic with several conferences and a major marching band event. Missed a day of housekeeping but not devastating. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. Incredibly convenient to the convention center and to several surrounding restaurants. Loved the inside walkways allowing for travel through the downtown area without having to venture out in the cold.

Location. the hotel is downtown Indianapolis and is connected to the Indianapolis Convention Center so you can walk from your hotel into the shopping mall and convention center. It is within easy walking distance to great restaurants as well as shopping the Lucas Oil Stadium and Indy Speedway and about 20 30 minutes from the airport depending on traffic. Getting an Uber to the hotel was quick and easy. The hotel has an indoor pool a hot tub and a fitness center along with 3 bars and restaurants including a revolving rooftop restaurant. Hotel Room The check in process was smooth and easy and the staff were attentive and friendly. The room was a decent size and clean. The room was dated and the bathroom was in need of updating as the ceiling panel was hanging down. I recommend that housekeeping clean the walls in the bathroom. The bed was not as comfortable as I would have liked but all in all the hotel was a good choice and I would stay there again on a business trip.

Renovations needed. We stayed at the Hyat Regency Indianapolis location for a convention. Upon check in I noticed the Room was not very clean. Dust on drinking glasses spilled items in the fridge and the windows not very clear. There were several plug ins not working in areas you needed them the most. It took my wife 30 minutes to remove the shampoo and conditioner out of her hair do to very low water pressure and a poor shower head.

Great hotel for an event. Visited for a business event taking place in the hotel and everything was quite impressive. The hotel is beautiful the staff very accommodating and all of the food was delicious. The rooms are very nice the beds are on the firm side a little bit different if you are used to memory foam at home but not too bad. I do wish that the windows opened for fresh air. Overall a great visit and would gladly return.
